content.raw: I'm still not 100% sure that this line is needed. I think it should be `_material.dataPtr = nullptr`. It seems that you're being "nice" and giving `_material` a new fresh portion of allocated memory but as far as I know, the original rvalue reference \(`_material`\) doesn’t need to have a meaningful value anymore, as it will be destroyed or assigned afterwards.
content.html: I'm still not 100% sure that this line is needed. I think it should be _material.dataPtr = nullptr. It seems that you're being "nice" and giving _material a new fresh portion of allocated memory but as far as I know, the original rvalue reference (_material) doesn’t need to have a meaningful value anymore, as it will be destroyed or assigned afterwards.
